sentence.Network_en: He became embroiled in a dispute with his neighbours.
sentence.Network_cn: 他与邻居们发生了争执。

sentence.Network_en: John and Peter were quarrelling, but Mary refused to get embroiled.
sentence.Network_cn: 约翰和彼得在争吵, 但玛丽不愿卷入.

sentence.Network_en: I don't want to become embroiled in their quarrels.
sentence.Network_cn: 我不愿卷到他们的争吵中去.

教甄-英文-阿摩云端题库 ... fluctuated 波动, 变动 embroiled 卷入(纠纷)的 degenerated 衰退, 堕落, 变坏.
这词变得相当流行（fad），每当官员们被卷入（embroiled）纠纷，就会这样去说辩解自己所面对的巨大压力。Fad是一时的风尚。

entry.def: If you become embroiled in a fight or argument, you become deeply involved in it.

example.ex: The Government insisted that troops would not become embroiled in battles in Bosnia.
example.tran: 政府坚称军队不会卷入波斯尼亚的冲突。

entry.tran: 与…有牵连的;与…发生纠葛的
entry.def: If you become embroiled with a person, you become involved in a relationship with them that causes you problems.

example.ex: As Smith became embroiled with his new lover, the marriage was called off.
example.tran: 史密斯和新情人纠缠不清，导致他的婚姻告吹。

means.word_mean: 1. deeply involved especially in something complicated;

auth_sentence.content: I did not mean to get embroiled in this.
auth_sentence.res_content: I did not mean to get embroiled in this.

auth_sentence.content: The Israeli-Palestinian conflict is not embroiled in questions of oil.
auth_sentence.res_content: The Israeli-Palestinian conflict is not embroiled in questions of oil.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The Israeli-Palestinian conflict is not embroiled in questions of oil.

auth_sentence.content: September - Chirac embroiled in corruption scandal.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: September - Chirac embroiled in corruption scandal.
